article.headline: Fresno State 82, UC-Irvine 51
article.story: FRESNO, Calif. (AP) -- Eddie Miller scored 23 points, including seven 3-pointers, as Fresno State beat UC Irvine 82-51 on Sunday night. Dominic McGuire added 13 points, six rebounds, five assists, four blocks and two steals for Fresno State (3-0). The Bulldogs broke open the game with a 3-pointer barrage in the second half. Miller made five of his 3-pointers in the second half, including two during a 13-0 spurt that turned the game into a blowout. Fresno State's lead swelled to as large as 36 points before both coaches began liberal substitutions. Hector Hernandez added 12 points for the Bulldogs. Quinton Hosley had eight points and a game-high 10 rebounds. Patrick Sanders scored 16 points and Darren Fells added 13 points and seven rebounds for UC Irvine (1-2). Fresno State led 35-24 at halftime thanks to a 13-0 scoring run fueled by McGuire and Hosley. McGuire made two jumpers during the surge and set up a Hosley dunk with a steal and assist. Sanders and Fells combined for 20 of the Anteaters' 24 first-half points. UC Irvine shot just 34.7 percent from the field, including 5-of-19 from beyond the arc.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
